images.summary: This detail shows the top view of a Long 'D' Ring - Dolly. The dimension '24 1/2"' indicates the length of the dolly, while '2"' specifies its width. The section callout '3/S1' refers to this specific view on sheet S1. The drawing is scaled at 1:8, providing a detailed representation of the component's dimensions and layout. The dolly is part of a structural steel assembly, designed for lifting applications.

images.summary: This detail presents the front view of a Long 'D' Ring - Dolly. The dimensions '49.5째' and '40.5째' indicate the angles of the top corners, while '4"', '6"', '3 1/2"', '30"', '17"', '3"', and '24 1/2"' specify various lengths and widths of the component. The material is a 2" thick AISI 4142 steel plate. The section callout '2/S1' identifies this view on sheet S1. The drawing emphasizes the need for clear labeling of the maximum capacity and notes that the lifting beam is not shown for clarity. The plate cut-out is to be salvaged for alternate use.

images.element_type: Long 'D' Ring - Dolly Front View with Parameters
images.text_verbatim:
PARAMETERS
MAXIMUM LIFTING CAPACITY (MAXIMUM LOAD): 17 TONS PER LINK. SEE TABLE FOR REDUCED CAPACITIES.
LIFTING CAPACITY MUST BE CLEARLY LABELED ON THE LIFTING DEVICE.
A PERMANENT RECORD MUST BE KEPT OF THIS DRAWING.
DEVICE MUST BE OPERATED AND MAINTAINED AS PER SECTION 51 OF O.REG. 851 (INDUSTRIAL ESTABLISHMENTS) UNDER THE OHSA.
LIFTING LUGS ARE DESIGNED FOR VERTICAL LIFTS ONLY.
SPECIAL PROVISIONS SHALL BE MADE TO ENSURE LIFTING LUGS ARE CENTERED ON THE SHACKLE PIN.
STRUCTURAL STEEL
STRUCTURAL STEEL SHALL CONFORM TO THE LATEST EDITION OF S16-09
PLATES TO BE AISI 4142 (Fy = 100 ksi) MATERIAL (MINIMUM).
ALL STRUCTURAL STEEL SHALL BE NEW MATERIAL.
ALL PLATES PAINTED AS SPECIFIED BY THE OWNER.
REDUCED CAPACITY - SHACKLE PIN DIA.
3" DIA.
MAX CAPACITY (TONS)
17

PLATE CUT-OUT TO BE SALVAGED FOR ALTERNATE USE

LONG "D" RING - DOLLY - FRONT VIEW
SCALE: 1:8
images.summary: This detail provides the front view of a Long 'D' Ring - Dolly, along with its design parameters and specifications. The maximum lifting capacity is 17 tons per link, with a 3" diameter shackle pin. The drawing emphasizes the need for clear labeling of the lifting capacity and compliance with safety regulations under the OHSA. The structural steel used is AISI 4142 with a minimum yield strength of 100 ksi. The section callout '2/S1' identifies this view on sheet S1. The drawing notes that the lifting beam is not shown for clarity and that the plate cut-out should be salvaged for alternate use. The material is specified as a 2" thick AISI 4142 steel plate.
